Fitch currently rates Sanmina as follows: --Long-term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) 'BB+'; --Senior secured revolving credit facility 'BBB- / RR1'; --Senior secured notes 'BB+ /RR3'. column4: Dealmaking heats up for oil pricing agencies as IHS buys OPIS
column5: Information provider IHS Inc has agreed to buy U.S. oil pricing agency OPIS as deal making in the oil pricing industry heats up after regulators' scrutiny cools.

column4: UPDATE 2-Dealmaking heats up for oil pricing agencies as IHS buys OPIS
column5: Jan 11 Information provider IHS Inc has agreed to buy U.S. oil pricing agency OPIS as deal making in the oil pricing industry heats up after regulators' scrutiny cools.

column4: NORDIC STOCKS - Factors to watch on Jan 11
column5: The following stocks may be affected by newspaper reports and other factors on Monday:

column4: MOVES-Sun Life Financial names Randolph Brown chief investment officer
column5: Jan 11 Canadian insurer Sun Life Financial Inc  appointed Deutsche Bank AG's Randolph Brown as its chief investment officer  effective immediately.

column4: Suncor gets more than 40 percent of votes in favor of COS bid: source
column5: TORONTO Suncor Energy Inc has received more than 40 percent of the votes in favor of its bid for Canadian Oil Sands Ltd  a source familiar with the situation said on Monday.

column4: BRIEF-TSMC orders equipment from Uangyih-Tech  Screen  Nova Measuring  Tokyo Electron
column5: * Says orders machinery equipment worth T$2.6 billion  ($77.98 million)

column4: Taiwan stocks fall; TSMC  Hon Hai down on lower December sales
column5: TAIPEI  Jan 11 Taiwan stocks fell on Monday  heading for their fifth session of loss in six  as investors stayed cautious over market routs in China and market heavyweights TSMC and Hon Hai Precision  declined on lower December sales.

column4: UPDATE 1-Telefonica set for Spanish infrastucture unit sale by July - source
column5: MADRID  Jan 11 Spain's Telefonica has started to spin-off its domestic  infrastructure unit and will seek to list or make a trade sale in a so-called 'dual track' offer process by mid-2016  a source familiar with the matter said on Monday.

column4: Spain's Telefonica to do 'dual track' with towers  cables in H1 - source
column5: MADRID  Jan 11 Spain's Telefonica has started to spin-off its domestic telecoms towers and cables into a new unit worth up to 6 billion euros  ($6.53 billion) that it will list or partially sell in a so-called 'dual track' process by mid-2016  a source familiar with the process said.

column4: Toyota bets on Lexus flagship revamp to overcome 'boring' image
column5: DETROIT Toyota Motor Corp is sprucing up its premium Lexus line with a facelift of its flagship sports coupe for 2017  as the world's largest automaker tries to shake off its reputation for boring designs.

column4: UPDATE 1-Toyota bets on Lexus flagship revamp to overcome 'boring' image
column5: DETROIT  Jan 11 Toyota Motor Corp is sprucing up its premium Lexus line with a facelift of its flagship sports coupe for 2017  as the world's largest automaker tries to shake off its reputation for boring designs.

column4: Unilever returns to Cuba in joint venture with state
column5: HAVANA Global consumer products company Unilever Plc  will return to Cuba after a several-year absence  agreeing on Monday to build a $35 million soap and toothpaste factory in Cuba's special development zone at the port of Mariel west of Havana.

column4: Unilever returns to Cuba in joint venture with state
column5: HAVANA  Jan 11 Global consumer products company Unilever Plc  will return to Cuba after a several-year absence  agreeing on Monday to build a $35 million soap and toothpaste factory in Cuba's special development zone at the port of Mariel west of Havana.

column4: Sequoia Fund is sued over big Valeant stake
column5: NEW YORK The investment firm that runs the Sequoia Fund  long known for its ties to Warren Buffett  was sued by shareholders who claim it recklessly took a huge stake in embattled drug company Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  causing more than $2 billion in losses.

column4: 'Force Awakens' grosses $53 million in China  now third biggest movie ever
column5: Star Wars: The Force Awakens broke records in China with $53 million in ticket sales on its first weekend  propelling the movie to become the third highest-grossing film globally in history  Walt Disney Co said on Sunday. | Video
